result.execSummary:
Thomas A Manley was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Thomas A Manley was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas A Manley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 1:19pm. 
Defendant Thomas A Manley in court, in custody.  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Extradition Complaint admitted; reading is waived. 
Right to counsel given. Extradition rights are given.
Mr. Manley indicates that he understands these rights and he intends to waive Extradition. 
Mr. Manley signs the Extradition form. 
Thomas Manley- sworn & testifies
--examination by the Court
The Court finds that Mr. Manley is competent to represent himself. 
The Court accepts Mr. Manley's Waiver of Extradition Rights. 
recess 1:27pm. 

NEXT:  schedule Status Conference in Branch III within 30 days to ensure that the Michigan authorities have picked up Mr. Manley (if so, then this hearing is to be removed from the Court's calendar)
